document_data.name: Black Eagle Coster
document_data.mainbody:
The '''Black Eagle coster''' was a trading company whose headquarters, little more than a warehouse, was located on the eastern side of [[Ashabenford]] in late 14{{th}} century [[DR]]. They would purchase locally made food stuffs like grain, cheese, ale and salted meats and sell them out in [[Hillsfar]], [[Harrowdale]] and [[Scardale]], to be sold and shipped overseas.

The company's ownership consisted of a five-man partnership of former adventurers led by the swordsman [[Iletian Blackeagle]].
